turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Object-oriented analysis and design.
turn.1: What is the difference between Object oriented analysis and design and traditional analysis and design?
turn.2: The design model should have all the details required so that programmers can implement the design in code..
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The purpose of any analysis activity in the software life-cycle is to create a model of the system's functional requirements that is independent of implementation constraints.
turn.5: Is the analysis and design the same as traditional analysis and design?
turn.6: The main difference between object-oriented analysis and other forms of analysis is that by the object-oriented approach we organize requirements around objects, which integrate both behaviors (processes) and states (data) modeled after real world objects that the system interacts with.
turn.8: In other or traditional analysis methodologies, the two aspects: processes and data are considered separately.
turn.10: For example, data may be modeled by ER diagrams, and behaviors by flow charts or structure charts.
turn.11: What are some of the objects that are used for OOP?
turn.12: Common models used in OOA are use cases and object models.
